_header: Alone am I and will to be alone
Subjects: lover’s lament; lovers, absence/separation of; envoys
_description: On the death of his mistress — three 8-line stanzas and 4-line Envoy (including ‘Alone’ anaphora and refrain, ‘Alone y lyue an ofcast creature’)

CULAdd2585.First Lines:
Alone am y and will to be alloneAlone withouten pleser or
                    gladnesAlone in care to sigh and groneAlone to waile the deth of my
                    mastres…
CULAdd2585.Last Lines:
…Alone I lyue that willith hit were lesseAlone y lyue an of
                    cast creature
CULAdd2585.Note:
Transcript of the twentieth century in the same MS on f. 2, ‘from
                    the flyleaves of a copy of the Spaera of John of Sacrobosco’,
                    giving old shelfmark for this MS ‘M.11.62’.
